decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of 22/06/2022, when original permission for 203650FUL was granted.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing/document titles: 20-010 - P01 Rev.B - Proposed OS Plan, 20-010 - P02 Rev.D - Proposed Site Plan, 20-010 - P03 Rev.D - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 20-010 - P04 Rev.C - Proposed Basement Floor Plan, 20-010 - P05 Rev.C - Proposed First Floor Plan, 20-010 - P06 Rev.C - Proposed Second Floor Plan, 20-010 - P07 Rev.B - Proposed Roof Plan, 20-010 - P08 - Proposed Front elevation (West Facing), 20-010 - P09 Rev.B - Proposed Rear Elevation (East Facing), 20-010 - P10 Rev.A - Proposed Side Elevation (North Facing), 20-010 - P11 Rev.C - Proposed Side Elevation (South Facing), 20-010 - P12 Rev.C - Proposed Side Elevations (Context), 20-010 - P13 Rev.A - Proposed Section, Addendum Daylight & Sunlight Report prepared by Waterslade dated April 2024.

Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | The details of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the building shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 224870CND dated 14.12.2022.
The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The details of the design of the secure cycle parking facilities shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 231304CND dated 26.01.2024.
These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG and policies T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The details of the design of the design and operation of the facilities for the storage and removal of refuse shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 231311CND dated 26.01.2024.
These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021), 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The details of the design of the Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 225015CND dated 19.05.2023.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), polices D14 and T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, works to provide the hard and soft landscaping (incl. trees, shrubs and plants) shown on Drawing No. 20-010-P02 (Revision A; dated 30/11/2020 as received on 28/01/2021) of the Approved Plans shall be carried out in full, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and maintained permanently. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season and maintained permanently.

Reason: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area, ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, and providing sustainable urban drainage in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | No trees, shrubs or hedges within or surrounding the site that are shown to be retained on Drawing No. 20-010-P02 (Revision A; dated 30/11/2020 as received on 28/01/2021) of the Approved Plans shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any trees, shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, providing sustainable urban drainage, and protecting the visual amenity of the local area and privacy of habitable rooms within the development in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B, 7.3 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Class L of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (As Amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the proposed self-contained dwelling units (Use Class C3) shall not be used for a use falling within Class C4 (Houses in Multiple Occupation) of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use and to safeguard amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and living conditions of occupants of the development in accordance with the GLA's Supplementary Planning Guidance on Housing (2023), as well as, policies 3.5 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The details of the drainage strategy shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 225017CND dated 26.05.2023.

The approved drainage strategy shall be implemented prior to the commencement of development and, thereafter, be permanently maintained. Additionally, no discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been implemented.

Reason: To reduce the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan (2021); as well as 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB). The sound insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building). The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021); Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The details of the enhanced sound insulation shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 225018CND dated 14.12.2022.
Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021); Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73.a) to vary condition 2 (approved drawing/document) of planning permission ref: 203650FUL dated 22/06/2022 for: Construction of a two storey residential building with habitable roof space and basement level, to accommodate  9 self-contained residential units (1 x 1-bedroom, 5 x 2-bedroom & 3 x 3-bedroom) (following demolition of the existing building) and associated private and communal amenity space, refuse, cycle storage and relocated driveway crossover. Amendment seeks to reduce the footprint and massing at the rear to the first and loft floors, whilst retaining the architectural design and accommodation schedule; to incorporate the recently approved discharge of planning condition 4 (cycle parking) and planning condition 5 (refuse and recycling storage)
